item.title: Why do smart pointers null out the wrapped pointer before destroying it?
item.description: When you null out a smart pointer type, the smart pointer type nulls out the old pointer before releasing it, rather than releasing the member and then setting it to null. (All source code samples has been simplified for expository purposes.)
